definitions.text: a point located with respect to surface features of some region
examples: this is a nice place for a picnic
a bright spot on a planet

definitions.text: a short section or illustration (as between radio or tv programs or in a magazine) that is often used for advertising
an outstanding characteristic
examples: his acting was one of the high points of the movie

definitions.text: a blemish made by dirt
examples: he had a smudge on his cheek

definitions.text: a small contrasting part of something
a section of an entertainment that is assigned to a specific performer or performance
examples: they changed his spot on the program

definitions.text: a business establishment for entertainment
a job in an organization
examples: he occupied a post in the treasury

definitions.text: a slight attack of illness
examples: he has a touch of rheumatism

definitions.text: a small piece or quantity of something
examples: I gave him a bit of my mind

definitions.text: a mark on a die or on a playing card (shape depending on the suit)
a lamp that produces a strong beam of light to illuminate a restricted area; used to focus attention of a stage performer
a playing card with a specified number of pips on it to indicate its value
an act that brings discredit to the person who does it
examples: he made a huge blot on his copybook

definitions.text: catch sight of
detect with the senses
examples: The fleeing convicts were picked out of the darkness by the watchful prison guards
I can't make out the faces in this photograph

definitions.text: mar or impair with a flaw
make a spot or mark onto
become spotted
mark with a spot or spots so as to allow easy recognition
examples: spot the areas that one should clearly identify
